text: The Wright Pathfinder was a single-decker body of a bus. It had a low-floor. It was made from 1993 to 1995 by Wrightbus."The Model Page" Bus & Coach Preservation February 2018 page 64 The Pathfinder body was built on the Dennis Lance SLF chassisWright launches single-door Pathfinder Commercial Motor 14 April 1994 and the Scania N113CRL chassis. In 1995, The Pathfinder was replaced with the Wright Axcess-Ultralow.Low price-tag on low-floor bus Commercial Motor 16 March 1995 ==Operators== From 1993 to 1995, London Regional Transport ordered 38 Dennis Lance SLFs with Wright Pathfinder bodywork. and 30 Scania N113CRLs with Wright Pathfinder bodywork. They were London's first low-floor buses. They were used on London routes 120 and on 222."A Scania returns" Bus & Coach Preservation March 2017 page 46Wright Pathfinder Bus Lists on the Web From 1993 to 1995, Badgerline, London & Country and Northern General ordered Dennis Lance SLFs with Wright Pathfinder bodywork. ==References== * Millar, Alan (2007) Bus & Coach Recognition : Ian Allan Ltd., ==Other websites== Category:Low-floor buses Pathfinder
title: Wright Pathfinder
